data.title: British bikers nabbed for disturbance in Phuket
data.description: Nine British nationals riding around  Phuket  in the early hours have been apprehended for disturbing the public peace after police received numerous complaints from residents and tourists.

data.title: Pathum Thani official stabbed to death
data.description: A senior local administrator was found dead with multiple stab wounds to her neck at her house in Khlong Luang district of Pathum Thani on Friday night.

data.title: British bikers nabbed for public disturbance in Phuket
data.description: Nine British nationals riding around  Phuket  in the early hours have been apprehended for disturbing the public peace after police received numerous complaints from residents and tourists.

data.title: Cambodia talks to restart soon
data.description: Cambodia has been informed that negotiations on disputed maritime areas under the 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) will resume after a joint technical committee (JTC) is formed by the middle of this month, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra says.

data.title: National Health Security Office to investigate clinics that deny patient referrals
data.description: The National Health Security Office (NHSO) will probe clinics that fail to refer universal healthcare patients to hospitals, saying such conduct could result in legal action and punishment.

data.title: National Human Rights Commission endorses citizenship for minorities, migrants
data.description: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) welcomed the government

data.title: MoU talks to restart soon
data.description: Cambodia has been informed that negotiations on disputed maritime areas under the 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) will resume after a joint technical committee (JTC) is formed by the middle of this month, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra says.

data.title: More floods hit Mae Sai  as market bears brunt
data.description: CHIANG RAI: Locals of Mae Sai district have had to endure a fresh round of damage after more floods struck less than a month after recovering from rainy season inundation.

data.title: No change, no charter
data.description: The referendum is, without a doubt, intertwined with the fate of the constitutional amendment.

data.title: 'Live Airport' project offers cultural flair for travellers
data.description: A "Live Airport" concept has been piloted at Phitsanulok and Nan airports to promote both provinces

data.title: MoU talks to restart soon
data.description: Cambodia has been informed that negotiations on disputed maritime areas under the 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) will resume after a joint technical committee (JTC) is formed by the middle of this month, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra says.

data.title: NHRC endorses citizenship for minorities, migrants
data.description: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) yesterday welcomed the government

data.title: NHSO to investigate clinics that deny patient referrals
data.description: The National Health Security Office (NHSO) will probe clinics that fail to refer universal healthcare patients to hospitals, saying such conduct could result in legal action and punishment.

data.title: Online game 'rapist' arrested
data.description: Online game

data.title: Thai FDA: Grapes meet safety standards
data.description: All imported  Shine Muscat grapes  have met  food safety  standards, according to the Thai Food and Drug Administration (FDA), responding to public concern about recent reports of chemical contamination.

data.title: Bodies of four Thai workers arrive home
data.description: The bodies of four  Thai workers  killed by Hezbollah rocket fire in northern  Israel  on Oct 31 arrived at Suvarnabhumi airport on Friday.

data.title: Princess shares Year of the Snake drawing
data.description: Her Royal Highness  Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn  has issued a drawing featuring snake caricatures that represent the animal zodiac for the coming  Year of the Snake .

data.title: PM to push trade deal at Peru summit
data.description: Thailand will advocate a  Free Trade Area  of the Asia-Pacific (FTAAP) that focuses on sustainable growth and innovation during the  Apec summit  in Peru next week, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

data.title: Moo Deng rewarded for picking Trump
data.description: The celebrity pygmy hippo  Moo Deng  was given a special mixed fruit platter on Friday as a reward after she “predicted” that Donald Trump would win the US presidential election.

data.title: Celebrity lawyer and wife remanded in custody
data.description: Celebrity lawyer Sittra Biabungkerd and his wife Patthitta Biabungkerd have been remanded in custody on fraud and money laundering charges after the Criminal Court denied Ms Patthitta’s bail request. Mr Sittra did not apply for bail.

data.title: Troops seize 400,000 speed pills abandoned in Chiang Mai
data.description: CHIANG MAI - Soldiers seized 400,000 speed pills  that had been abandoned in a garden in Fang district of this northern province on Friday.

data.title: Malaysian state proposes erecting 100km border wall
data.description: Kelantan state opposite Narathiwat province will propose the government to build a 100-kilometre-long wall in a new move to crack down on cross-border crimes and smuggling.

data.title: Celebrity lawyer will not seek bail on fraud, money-laundering case
data.description: High-profile lawyer Sittra Biabungkerd, who was arrested along with his wife Patthitta Biabungkerd on fraud and money-laundering charges, has decided not to apply for bail for himself but intends to seek temporary release for her, their lawyer said on Friday.

data.title: Kelantan state to seek okay from KL to build border wall along Thai border
data.description: Kelantan state opposite Narathiwat province will propose the government to build a 100-kilometre-long wall in a new move to crack down on cross-border crimes and smuggling.

data.title: Defence minister to visit Koh Kut to assert sovereignty
data.description: Defence Minister Phumtham Wechayachai will visit Koh Kut in Trat on Saturday to reassert Thailand

data.title: First Thai veteran in Korean War to be buried in S. Korea
data.description: When the remains of Command Sergeant Major Rod Asanapan are laid to rest at a memorial cemetery in South Korea next week, he will be the first Thai veteran of the Korean War to rest in peace in the land where he served for one year.

data.title: 'Multidimensional poverty' a worry despite progress
data.description: While Thailand has managed to cut the number of people living in poverty by half in just seven years, many Thais still live with substandard living conditions-- lacking access to adequate healthcare, education, and sanitation -- especially those living in rural areas, according to the 2024 Global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI).

data.title: Songkhla 'terrorist' gets jail time
data.description: Azman Porloh, a 29-year-old suspect in several terrorist attacks in Songkhla province, is facing more than five years

data.title: UN launches chemical sex health toolkit
data.description: Two United Nations (UN) agencies launched a chemical sex health toolkit yesterday during a two-day symposium held in Bangkok.

data.title: Migrants risk losing right to work, stay
data.description: Many employers and migrant workers have complained about problems tied to the new registration and work permit renewal requirements, which have reportedly led to large numbers of migrant workers missing the deadline and losing their legal status.
